title: Leapfrog: Quantum computing has entered the era of utility
summary: The progress being made in quantum computing over the last few years has been incredible: devices with hundreds of qubits, meaning access and open-source software so anyone can program them. Last year, our team at IBM alongside colleagues at University of California, Berkeley published a demonstr...
content:
This article first appeared in Digital Edge, The Edge Malaysia Weekly on March 11, 2024 - March 17, 2024

The progress being made in quantum computing over the last few years has been incredible: devices with hundreds of qubits, meaning access and open-source software so anyone can program them. Last year, our team at IBM alongside colleagues at University of California, Berkeley published a demonstration of “quantum utility” in the scientific journal, Nature.

title: Current account surplus to improve in 2024
summary: PETALING JAYA: Amid external headwinds, Malaysia is expected to see an improvement in the current account surplus this year after it substantially shrank to a mere 1.2% of gross domestic product (GDP) last year.
content:
PETALING JAYA: Amid external headwinds, Malaysia is expected to see an improvement in the current account surplus this year after it substantially shrank to a mere 1.2% of gross domestic product (GDP) last year.

Economists are projecting the current account surplus to widen between 2.5% and 2.8% this year underpinned by improvement in trade, the bottoming of the global electronics downcycle and strong tourism inflows. In 2022, the current account surplus was at 3.1% of GDP.<

title: Residential sector to enjoy growth in 2024
summary: PETALING JAYA: In the face of a challenging economic landscape caused by high-interest rates and inflationary pressures, Malaysia’s property market has not only weathered the storm but has, in fact, set a new record in 2023.
content:
PETALING JAYA: In the face of a challenging economic landscape caused by high-interest rates and inflationary pressures, Malaysia’s property market has not only weathered the storm but has, in fact, set a new record in 2023.

Property transaction value soared to RM196.83bil in 2023, representing a 9.91% year-on-year (y-o-y) surge from the previous record set in 2022 at RM179.07bil, as reported by the National Property Information Centre (Napic) last week.

These numbers

title: Call for plywood manufacturers to diversify into niche global markets
summary: KUCHING: Malaysian plywood manufacturers should diversify into producing hardwood plywood products for niche markets internationally beyond the construction industry.
content:
International Tropical Timber Organisation (Itto) executive director Sheam Satkuru

KUCHING: Malaysian plywood manufacturers should diversify into producing hardwood plywood products for niche markets internationally beyond the construction industry.

They can consider diversifying into the production of wooden flooring, high-density fibreboard and wood panels that cater to interior usage of buildings, according to International Tropical Timber Organisati

content:

PETALING JAYA: Price-sensitive consumers are anticipated to be more cautious in their discretionary spending this year, mainly due to the global economic slowdown.

MIDF Research in a report said consumer spending will also be impacted by potentially higher inflationary pressure due to fiscal measures.

title: Polish govt pledges grain surplus cut, farmers protest
summary: WARSAW: Poland’s prime minister has pledged to reduce a grain surplus on the domestic market at talks with farmers last Saturday, a government official says, but union leaders say they were pressing on with weeks of protests.
content:
FILE PHOTO: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk in Parliament, in Warsaw, Poland December 12, 2023. REUTERS/Aleksandra Szmigiel/File Photo

WARSAW: Poland’s prime minister has pledged to reduce a grain surplus on the domestic market at talks with farmers last Saturday, a government official says, but union leaders say they were pressing on with weeks of protests.

Prime Minister Donald Tusk held three hours of talks in Warsaw with the farmers, who are deman

title: Xcel Texas wildfire legal reckoning to last for years
summary: HOUSTON: Xcel Energy Inc will likely be wrangling for years with the legal fallout from the wildfires burning through the Texas Panhandle.
content:
A destroyed home following the Smokehouse Creek Fire in Miami, Texas.Photographer: Jordan Vonderhaar/Bloomberg

HOUSTON: Xcel Energy Inc will likely be wrangling for years with the legal fallout from the wildfires burning through the Texas Panhandle.

The experience of utility companies in California and Oregon sued over massive blazes sparked by downed power lines shows that litigation takes at least three years to play out.

title: China reiterates that homes are not for speculation
summary: Beijing: China reiterated a stance that homes are for residents to live in, and not for speculation, keeping to its longstanding position even as a property crisis weighs on demand.
content:
The clarification came after a work report draft omitted the slogan “housing is for living in, not speculation”. - PHOTO: REUTERS

Beijing: China reiterated a stance that homes are for residents to live in, and not for speculation, keeping to its longstanding position even as a property crisis weighs on demand.

“We must adhere, to the very end, the belief that housing is for living in, not for speculation,” China’s Housing and Urban-Rural Development Mi

title: Mercu Maybank wins Fiabci's office category award
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Mercu Maybank, a Grade A GBI corporate tower in i-City , Shah Alam has secured the Fiabci Malaysia Property Award 2023 in the office category for its innovative initiatives, a feat attained within just two years of its operation.Tan ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Mercu Maybank, a Grade A GBI corporate tower in i-City , Shah Alam has secured the Fiabci Malaysia Property Award 2023 in the office category for its innovative initiatives, a feat attained within just two years of its operation.

Tan Sri Lim Kim Hong, chairman of I-Berhad, hailed the accolade as a "remarkable achievement," underscoring the company's dedication to architectural excellence and urban advancement.

title: Ringgit likely to continue uptrend against US dollar next week
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit is expected to continue its uptrend against the US dollar next week, supported by improving sentiment amid an encouraging domestic environment, said Bank Muamalat Malaysia Bhd chief economist Mohd Afzanizam Abdul Rashid.He said the local ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit is expected to continue its uptrend against the US dollar next week, supported by improving sentiment amid an encouraging domestic environment, said Bank Muamalat Malaysia Bhd chief economist Mohd Afzanizam Abdul Rashid.

He said the local note is likely to trend between 4.67 and 4.69 against the greenback next week following its significant rise in the previous week.

"Sentiments on the ringgit are expected to improve, while the Bank Negara Malaysia's (BNM) opinion on the undervaluation of th

title: Bursa Malaysia likely to consolidate with upside bias next week
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Bursa Malaysia is expected to stay in consolidation mode with a slight positive bias next week ahead of important local and US reports.Apex Securities Bhd head of research Kenneth Leong said investors will be keeping a close ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Bursa Malaysia is expected to stay in consolidation mode with a slight positive bias next week ahead of important local and US reports.

Apex Securities Bhd head of research Kenneth Leong said investors will be keeping a close tab on Malaysia's industrial production data as well as the US Consumer Price Index report next week.

"Going forward, the extended recovery is expected to remain in place amid the calmer market conditions with the key index looking to test its recent high of 1,558 level.

"Any

title: Productivity per Malaysian worker up in 2023, says chief secretary to govt
summary: Chief Secretary to the government Tan Sri Mohd Zuki Ali revealed that the level of productivity per worker in Malaysia rose to RM96,692 in 2023, marking an increase from RM95,858 in 2022.
content:
KUALA TERENGGANU (March 10): Chief Secretary to the government Tan Sri Mohd Zuki Ali revealed that the level of productivity per worker in Malaysia rose to RM96,692 in 2023, marking an increase from RM95,858 in 2022.

He highlighted that the number of workers also saw a year-on-year increase of 2.5%, reaching a total of 16.3 million individuals, signifying a stable labour market and an uptick in the nation’s economic activities.

"This also reflects a positive tra

title: Mindef ready to be quizzed by PAC over LTAT’s dipping reserves, says minister
summary: The Defence Ministry is ready to provide an explanation to the Public Accounts Committee (PAC) regarding the negative reserve balance of the Armed Forces Fund Board (LTAT), should it be summoned.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (March 10): The Defence Ministry is ready to provide an explanation to the Public Accounts Committee (PAC) regarding the negative reserve balance of the Armed Forces Fund Board (LTAT), should it be summoned.

Minister Datuk Seri Mohamed Khaled Nordin said that the Auditor General's Report 2022 that brought the issue to light only highlighted a single fund, whereas LTAT had three reserve funds, which were collectively in a positive position during the specified year.

title: Lufthansa cabin crews to strike in German cities
summary: BERLIN: Lufthansa cabin crews have called a two-day strike next week in the German cities of Frankfurt and Munich, the UFO union announced Saturday, days after the airline announced record profits."On Thursday, the group announced a record result," said ...
content:
BERLIN: Lufthansa cabin crews have called a two-day strike next week in the German cities of Frankfurt and Munich, the UFO union announced Saturday, days after the airline announced record profits.

"On Thursday, the group announced a record result," said UFO union leader Joachim Vazquez Buerger.

"The cabin crew have to be able to benefit from this success, and the efforts made during the Coronavirus crisis must be rewarded."

The strike will cover flights out of Frankfurt on Tuesday and from Munich on Wednesday, with

title: Use "Palm Oil Free" labels and face up to RM250,000 fine, warns Plantation and Commodities Ministry
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The use of labels on products that discriminate against palm oil such as "palm oil free" is prohibited under the Trade Descriptions Act 2011, Plantation and Commodities Minister Datuk Seri Johari Abdul Ghani said. Malaysia's law imposes fines ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The use of labels on products that discriminate against palm oil such as "palm oil free" is prohibited under the Trade Descriptions Act 2011, Plantation and Commodities Minister Datuk Seri Johari Abdul Ghani said. 

Malaysia's law imposes fines of up to RM250,000 for any discrimination against products particularly palm oil, he added.

"The ministry will collaborate with the Ministry of Domestic Trade and Consumer Affairs to enforce and take immediate action against supermarkets that market such products,

title: KL Midtown open to selling Grade A corporate towers or branding rights
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Hap Seng Consolidated Bhd chairman Thomas Karl Rapp says KL Midtown is open to selling its two signature Grade A corporate towers en-bloc.Rapp also disclosed that these towers are available for naming rights, offering corporate branding opportunities ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Hap Seng Consolidated Bhd chairman Thomas Karl Rapp says KL Midtown is open to selling its two signature Grade A corporate towers en-bloc.

Rapp also disclosed that these towers are available for naming rights, offering corporate branding opportunities and prestige.

He said this in a statement following the topping-out ceremony for the five-star Hyatt Regency Kuala Lumpur at KL Midtown, which took place on the 32nd rooftop level recently.

The event was officiated by Karl Rapp, along with the directors o

title: Don’t question Sabah’s sovereignty, CM warns group
summary: “Do not question Sabah's sovereignty in Malaysia,” stressed Chief Minister Datuk Seri Hajiji Noor in response to the latest claims by a group calling themselves the United Tausug Citizens (UTC).
content:
KOTA KINABALU (March 10): “Do not question Sabah's sovereignty in Malaysia,” stressed Chief Minister Datuk Seri Hajiji Noor in response to the latest claims by a group calling themselves the United Tausug Citizens (UTC).

Hajiji said Sabahans had chosen to jointly form the Malaysia Federation through the Malaysia Agreement 1963 (MA63). Therefore, any external claims against the state of Sabah will not be recognised by the Sabah government or the people.

Echoing t

title: In high spirits
summary: Martell has always been defined by its audacity to create new expressions and ways to enjoy cognac. In Options’ cover story this week, chairman and CEO of Martell Mumm Perrier-Jouët César Giron explains the new and limited Asia-only Martell Single Cru collection, which will soon be released as part of the French cognac house’s 130th anniversary Malaysian celebrations.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (March 10): Martell has always been defined by its audacity to create new expressions and ways to enjoy cognac. In Options’ cover story this week, chairman and CEO of Martell Mumm Perrier-Jouët César Giron explains the new and limited Asia-only Martell Single Cru collection, which will soon be released as part of the French cognac house’s 130th anniversary Malaysian celebrations.

We had the opportunity of viewing the Martell Single Cru, a landmark collection in which every cognac is crafted

title: Towards better performance and business sustainability
summary: Pelaburan Hartanah Bhd (PHB) is embarking on a business transformation plan to boost the property investment company’s performance and ensure the sustainability of its business. Group managing director and CEO Mohamad Damshal Awang Damit said the company aims to diversify its portfolio to include more properties from the healthcare, education and logistics/industrial sectors, and increase its overall portfolio to RM25 billion by 2030.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (March 10): Pelaburan Hartanah Bhd (PHB) is embarking on a business transformation plan to boost the property investment company’s performance and ensure the sustainability of its business. Group managing director and CEO Mohamad Damshal Awang Damit said the company aims to diversify its portfolio to include more properties from the healthcare, education and logistics/industrial sectors, and increase its overall portfolio to RM25 billion by 2030.
